ygData.subject: Re: Skill advancement

ygData.messageBody:
I tried to increase my skill in piercing by fighting greens, but never saw a
gain. But then I didn't see a gain against blues or higher levels, so I think I
need to put more points in. I'd like to see if it works. I thought I saw
somewhere that you only gain skill against blue mobs or higher. That is what I
notice when I raise my 1H and 2H slashing skills, as well as offense and
defense, etc.

The reason you occasionally get experience from greens and occasionally have a
blue that cleans your clock is because there appears to be a gradient in the
different colors. When you con a mob, look at the text. The greens I got
experience from said they were "risky" instead of the usual "looks like an easy
opponent" text.

A question I have for my fellow Barbarians who travel to Faydwer is: Have any of
you been able to find warrior training on the continent? I was able to get the
dwarven guards to view me as amiable by killing CB orcs, but I never could get
the Stormguard Hall Warriors guild NPC's to talk to me. They woudl say Felwithe
does not have a warriors guild and the Kelethin warriors guild you cannot get
into since it doesn't have double doors. I was never able to get inside a single
door building in Kelethin even by ducking. I never tried getting into Ak'Anon to
see if they had a guild I could get into. It is such a pain to have to hop the
boat back to Freeport just to train for new skills. I wish the Warriors guild in
Kelethin had double doors on it instead of the Rangers Guild. All the large
races cannot be rangers so what is the point? Is anyone else out there
experiencing the sam difficulties? Did I not kill enough orcs? I also cannot
turn in the belts to help boost the faction rating that way either.

Surtur
Barbarian Warrior of the 15th Circle
E'ci Server

James Schuldes wrote:

> From: James Schuldes <jgs@...>
>
> Your skills increase each time you use them no matter what the level of your
> opponent.
>
> You can stand over a spawn spot and swing away at rats and snakes for hours
> to build a new wep skill.
>
> Experience points are tied the level of the opponent though. But they are
> tied to other factors as well. I can swear that I have killed stuff that
> conned green (lower than blue) and have gotten xp from it. Why? I have no
> clue - maybe because you get a quota for each kind of mob in a zone? Or
> something. I'll max out on killing young lions which are/were blue and then
> have to slay a pesky bear which is green and get xp off the bear but not the
> young lion, go figure.
>
> As a rule, when I solo, I try not to attack yellows ('...quite a gamble...')
> or whites ('...looks like an even fight...') and of course not reds. I'd
> rather take more easy kills than suffer the heal time between long melee's.
> But I wonder if the gain in xp is worth it?
>
